result.execSummary:
All charges against Norman J Saffold in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Norman J Saffold is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

from Atty Watson RE Winnebago County in custody time; attachment
Zoom
Referral to Dane County Pretrial Services (DCPS)

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release. 
The Court ordered a signature bond on the condition that the defendant reports to and complies with Pretrial Services. The defendant shall report to Pretrial Services by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail. 
The following checked category(s) are also ordered: __ GPS, _x_ Remote Breath (Alcohol) Monitoring, and/or __ Random Drug Testing. 
NONCOMPLIANCE WILL BE REPORTED BY DCPS TO THE JUDICIARY WHO SHALL RESPOND IN ONE OF THESE WAYS: Schedule bail hearing, Increase Supervision, Issue warrant, No change but monitor. 
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Vivian C, Dylan H, or Roman S. 
- Defendant shall not possess any type of dangerous weapon [as defined by Wis. Stat. 939.22(10)]. 
- Defendant shall not consume or possess alcohol. 
Trial Judge - Br 17

Referral to DCPS for remote breath

Court reporter Teri Groves. Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Haley Ruesch Watson.  Lillian Rose Nelson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. In court today for a bail/bond hearing after return on warrant for cases 22CM140 and 22CM540. State requests signature bond with a referral to DCPS for remote breath testing and GPS. Atty Watson requests a signature bond with possible DCPS for remote breath testing and GPS. Court makes findings and grants a signature bond in both cases with a referral to DCPS for remote breath monitoring. All other bail conditions will remain the same.
Bail/bond hearing on June 1, 2022 at 10:15 am.

In court today for bail/bond hearing due to DCPS violations. State gives argument. Sarah Thomford from DCPS gives statement. Atty Watson objects to warrant being issued. Court makes findings and issues a body only bench warrant.
